definitions.definition: Free of dirt, filth, or impurities (extraneous matter); not dirty , filthy , or soiled .
examples: Are these dishes clean ? Your room is finally clean ! For a baby, happiness is a full bottle and a clean diaper.
clean steel

definitions.definition: Free of contamination, (unwanted) germs, infection , or disease .

subdefinitions.definition: Devoid of sexually transmitted diseases ( STDs ).
examples: I want to make sure my fiancé is clean before we are married.

definitions.definition: Free of imperfections, blemishes, or defects.

subdefinitions.definition: Of a victory or performance : without any blemishes such as submission holds , disqualification , interference , etc.
subdefinitions.label_groups: sports , for example , professional wrestling , slang

subdefinitions.definition: Free from that which is useless or injurious; without defects.
examples: clean land
clean timber
Put a clean sheet of paper into the printer.
Our kids can watch this movie because it is clean .
go clean
I've been clean this time for eight months.

subdefinitions.definition: Free from (or showing no signs of) corrupt, unlawful, and/or sinister conduct or connections (and ( of criminal, driving, etc. records ) therefore without restrictions or penalties ).
examples: Unlike you, I’ve never caused any accidents — my record is still clean !

subdefinitions.definition: Not in possession of weapons or contraband such as drugs.
examples: I'm clean , officer. You can go ahead and search me if you want.

definitions.definition: Free of infiltration by covert listening or recording devices ( bugs ), enemy spies, etc.
examples: We are currently clean on OPSEC.
The cargo hold is clean .
Mister, I want to see a clean dinner plate or there'll be no dessert for you.
I'll need a sharper knife to make clean cuts.
a clean leap over a fence
a clean left-footed shot into the top corner of the goal

definitions.definition: That does not damage the environment (as much as some alternative).
examples: clean energy
clean coal
clean tourism

definitions.definition: Allowing an uninterrupted flow over surfaces , without protrusions such as racks or landing gear .
Having the undercarriage and flaps in the up position .

examples: clean limbs
Wow, dude, those are some clean shoes ya got there!

definitions.definition: Utter, complete, total; pure; free from restraint.
examples: a clean sweep

main_definition: Free of dirt, filth, or impurities (extraneous matter); not dirty , filthy , or soiled .
secondary_definitions: Free of contamination, (unwanted) germs, infection , or disease .
Free of imperfections, blemishes, or defects.
Free of infiltration by covert listening or recording devices ( bugs ), enemy spies, etc.
That does not damage the environment (as much as some alternative).
( aerodynamics ) Allowing an uninterrupted flow over surfaces , without protrusions such as racks or landing gear .
( aviation ) Having the undercarriage and flaps in the up position .
Utter, complete, total; pure; free from restraint.
